com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell

Class ShellUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.ShellUtils

  • public abstract class ShellUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions for Bourne shell commands, including escaping and tokenizing.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ShellUtils.TokenizationException
      Thrown by tokenize method if there is an error

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String prettyPrintArgv(java.util.List<java.lang.String> argv)
      Given an argv array such as might be passed to execve(2), returns a string that can be copied and pasted into a Bourne shell for a similar effect.
      static java.lang.String shellEscape(java.lang.String word)
      Quotes a word so that it can be used, without further quoting, as an argument (or part of an argument) in a shell command.
      static void tokenize(java.util.List<java.lang.String> options, java.lang.String optionString)
      Populates the passed list of command-line options extracted from optionString, which is a string containing multiple options, delimited in a Bourne shell-like manner.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • shellEscape

        public static java.lang.String shellEscape(java.lang.String word)
        Quotes a word so that it can be used, without further quoting, as an argument (or part of an argument) in a shell command.

      • prettyPrintArgv

        public static java.lang.String prettyPrintArgv(java.util.List<java.lang.String> argv)
        Given an argv array such as might be passed to execve(2), returns a string that can be copied and pasted into a Bourne shell for a similar effect.

      • tokenize

        public static void tokenize(java.util.List<java.lang.String> options,
                            java.lang.String optionString)
                     throws ShellUtils.TokenizationException
        Populates the passed list of command-line options extracted from optionString, which is a string containing multiple options, delimited in a Bourne shell-like manner.
        Parameters:
        options - the list to be populated with tokens.
        optionString - the string to be tokenized.
        Throws:
        ShellUtils.TokenizationException - if there was an error (such as an unterminated quotation).
